intro: Senecio colensoensis, commonly known as the Colenso's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has hairy, serrated leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, dry seeds. Senecio colensoensis is often found in the North Island and is a component of the native flora in its habitat.
